-

The official tumblr of the unofficial Critical Role fanfiction zine, organised by @sparxwrites and @notalwaysweak.

summary: And that's a wrap on the writer signup! We've finished with a whopping TWENTY-SIX applications, which is absolutely amazing for...
body:
And that’s a wrap on the writer signup! We’ve finished with a whopping TWENTY-SIX applications, which is absolutely amazing for a first-time zine for a previous season of the show. Thanks to everyone who signed up, we’re so so so excited by your enthusiasm.

What happens now? Both the organisers will be going through the applications over the next few days, and then we’ll be sending emails out to people to let them know the outcomes. Then, it’s time for the authors to come up with their story ideas and get writing - which is where the real excitement begins…

blog.name: nottsbuttons
blog.title: in the name of being brave
blog.description: han - she/her

tags: this is entirely a self indulgent analysis because i was looking at the racial traits
summary: Also can we talk about how Nott used to be a halfing in terms of the mechanics of each race because I’m dying just a bit. So...
body:
Also can we talk about how Nott used to be a halfing in terms of the mechanics of each race because I’m dying just a bit. So here goes an overly complex self-indulgent analysis of halfling racial traits vs goblin racial traits 

I’m gonna assume she had the same base stats (before mods) as a halfling and a goblin, because the reincarnate spell (which has pretty much been confirmed) says this: 
“It retains the capabilities it had in its original form, except it exchanges its original race for the new one and changes its racial traits accordingly.”
Which I’m reading as: class and base stats stay the same (give me rogue!Veth) but the racial bonuses reset and the racial features change.

To start, let’s look at the halfling traits. We don’t know which variant of halfing she was, but all halflings get this:

Brave: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Nott the Brave lost Brave when she became a goblin. She is no longer Brave. Also she loses her advantage on saving throws against being frightened, which is interesting when you think about how the one benefit of her alcoholic intake is that she becomes immune to fear.

All halflings also get +2 dex, 25 movement, Lucky (reroll nat 1′s Nott does have the second-highest nat 1 count of tM9), and Halfling Nimbleness, which lets them move through spaces with larger creatures. 

But let’s say she was a Lightfoot halfling. Lightfoots get a +1 to Charisma, which kills me a bit because Nott’s got 5 charisma, which is a -3, and assuming base stats stayed the same, the extra +1 would bump her up to a -2 instead of a -3.

Lightfoots also get this:

Naturally Stealthy: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

Halfling Nimbleness and Naturally Stealthy being traits that Veth once used to avoid and run away from people chasing her (being able to duck quickly through crowds, hide, and lose her pursuers in them). She lost both of those when she became a goblin, and even though she’s still sneaky, it’s not quite the same.

Now looking at what she gained, her dex would’ve stayed the same because goblins also benefit from the +2 to dex racial boost. Her charisma would lower, because she’s not a halfling anymore, taking her from what she implied was somewhat of an outcast halfling who got teased to a much more actively disliked goblin. Her constitution increases by one, which would’ve happened at the time of the change, but is interesting to think about in the context of her alcoholism increasing when the change happened. Her movement increased to 30 feet, meaning she got a little bit quicker, and she has Nimble Escape, which lets her disengage and hide as bonus actions.

Nimble Escape and the Halfling Nimbleness + Naturally Stealthy combo serve similar purposes in terms of hiding and moving around quickly, but the halfling combo allows someone to hide in a crowd and move easily through people, while the Nimble Escape lets you get the fuck out and try to hide somewhere else. Veth went from being able to blend in easily and escape pursuers in a crowd to sticking out a lot more and having to get away and hide quickly when someone noticed her. Which is a subtle difference (she’s still able to hide and maneuver around a little better because of her small size) but still hurts when you think about it.

Finally, she gets Fury of the Small, a way to channel her ‘fury’ against creatures that are bigger than her. Veth didn’t have a lot to be angry about, and she seems based on what we know to have solved most things by running away until she absolutely had to fight. But Nott on the other hand does have things to be angry at, and she’s gotten in a lot of fights. Also it’s pretty much confirmed that the person who did her reincarnation was not a goblin and thus probably bigger than her but that’s just speculation

tldr; while Sam probably didn’t choose halfling because of the racial traits, the mechanics of the change fit the story we’ve gotten so Damn Well it kills me.

blog.name: pactmagic
blog.title: I saw seven birds
blog.description:
aka atlantisrises // She/her // queer geek //currently taking prompts // art

//ao3

summary: For the made up fic title meme: Tell You No Lies
question: For the made up fic title meme: Tell You No Lies
answer:
This immediately makes me think of Miracle by Chvrches ( the gorgeous acoustic version) so.

Whitestone-era Vex and Percy.

Vex knows that she loves Percy, she just hasn’t quite fallen in love with him yet, and at this point it’s possible she never will because he’s changing he’s changing he’s changing. Something vicious is eating the bright, odd man she knew away from the inside and she doesn’t know what to do. She can’t tell him that it will be okay, because she’s not sure it will.

And she thinks of the way he used to look at her, the way he used to know her, and she feels like begging. She reaches for him in the dark and says can you see me, can you see me can you still see me?

(send me a made-up fic title and i’ll tell you what I’d write to go with it!)

Vex knows that she loves Percy, she just hasn’t quite fallen in love with him yet, and at this point it’s possible she never will because he’s changing he’s changing he’s changing. Something vicious is eating the bright, odd man she knew away from the inside and she doesn’t know what to do. She can’t tell him that it will be okay, because she’s not sure it will.

And she thinks of the way he used to look at her, the way he used to know her, and she feels like begging. She reaches for him in the dark and says can you see me, can you see me can you still see me?

(send me a made-up fic title and i’ll tell you what I’d write to go with it!)
trail.content:
This immediately makes me think of Miracle by Chvrches ( the gorgeous acoustic version) so.

Whitestone-era Vex and Percy.

Vex knows that she loves Percy, she just hasn’t quite fallen in love with him yet, and at this point it’s possible she never will because he’s changing he’s changing he’s changing. Something vicious is eating the bright, odd man she knew away from the inside and she doesn’t know what to do. She can’t tell him that it will be okay, because she’s not sure it will.

And she thinks of the way he used to look at her, the way he used to know her, and she feels like begging. She reaches for him in the dark and says can you see me, can you see me can you still see me?

(send me a made-up fic title and i’ll tell you what I’d write to go with it!)
